mprParameters.Description: Batch editing/adding parameters to projects and families
mprParameters.Description1: Analog of the standard parameter editor of the current family, allowing to use an alternative formula editor
mprParameters.pcd1: Allows batch creation of parameters in the current project
mprParameters.pcd2: Allows batch creation of parameters in project families, open families, or families on disk
mprParameters.pcd3: Analog of the standard parameter editor of the current family, allowing to use an alternative formula editor
mprParameters.pcd4: Allows batch editing of parameters in the current project
mprParameters.pcd5: Allows batch editing of parameters in project families, open families, or families on disk
mprParameters.t4: Formula validation is performed by the family {0}
mprParameters.t5: The formula editor is opened based on the {0} family data. The formula is not validated
mprParameters.t12: Values can vary by group instance
mprParameters.t13: Values are aligned per group type
mprParameters.t17: Parameter exists in the current document
mprParameters.t58: Select the path to save the file
mprParameters.t78: Remove all families from the list
mprParameters.t87: Add selected parameters from the SPF to the current parameter list
mprParameters.t95: Remove selected parameters from the list
mprParameters.t96: Remove all parameters from the list
mprParameters.t102: Edit the list of categories of the selected parameters
mprParameters.t103: Create a custom parameter. The custom parameter will be a Shared parameter with a random GUID, but with no binding to a specific SPF
mprParameters.t109: Replace the shared parameter with a family parameter
mprParameters.t116: Count of families with this parameter
mprParameters.t123: Add the current formula to the favorites list
mprParameters.t124: Insert a formula from the favorites list
mprParameters.t131: The plugin's trial period is over! Purchase a plugin license or Revit subscription to continue using the "Parameters" plugin
mprParameters.t135: On plugin startup, open a section in the family document:
mprParameters.t136: Case sensitive searches in the list of data types, parameter groups, column filters and the dialog box for adding parameters from the SPF
mprParameters.t138: Select a new group for the parameter "{0}"
mprParameters.t141: After saving the family, all backup files of the form Family_name.nnnn.rfa next to the family file will be deleted
mprParameters.t142: Due to limitations in Revit API, if you change the group of a non-shared family parameter, the description will be lost!
mprParameters.t143: In the current family type, it is not possible to use the plugin. The family editor is open in Read Only mode
mprParameters.t144: The row corresponding to the parameter is not found in the imported file
mprParameters.t145: Failed to recognize the action in "{0}". Make sure that the application language matches the file being loaded
mprParameters.t146: An action from the value "{0}" is recognized but not added to the parameter "{1}" because the action is not applicable to the parameter or the parameter is already marked as deletable
mprParameters.t147: Failed to recognize the group specified in "{0}". Some group names may differ between Revit versions
mprParameters.t148: You do not have access to save presets to the organization's preset storage
mprParameters.t152: There are no saved presets for the current section in the storage
mprParameters.t156: Add an action to the selected parameters
mprParameters.t170: Associated with the "{0}" parameter of element ID={1}
mprParameters.t173: Revit API does not allow to retrieve an existing parameter ToolTip
mprParameters.t174: Replace the family parameter with a shared parameter
mprParameters.t176: Replace the shared parameter with another shared parameter
mprParameters.t179: Drag the parameters in the table to set their new position. It is allowed to drag multiple parameters, as well as to drag parameters to other groups
mprParameters.t180: Due to limitations in the Revit API, system parameters cannot be moved to other groups
mprParameters.t182: Import parameters from the selected family
mprParameters.t187: Import of parameters is performed by creating parameters in the current family with the characteristics of the selected parameters of the selected family and then setting the values ​​and formulas. When selecting a parameter with a formula, all parameters used in the formula will be added to the list. Import of system parameters is not possible. In the left part of the window, you must select the ratio of the types of the current and selected families, according to which the parameter values ​​will be copied
mprParameters.t188: Due to limitations in the Revit API, parameter imports lose parameter descriptions unless the selected shared parameter is present in the current shared parameter file
mprParameters.t190: Import a formula from a parameter of the selected family
mprParameters.t191: There are no parameters with formulas in the selected family
mprParameters.ad1: Allows you to rename a family parameter. The action is not available for system parameters and shared parameters
mprParameters.ad2: Allows you to change the group of the parameter. The action is not available for system parameters. If you change the group of a non-shared parameter of a family, the description will be lost
mprParameters.ad3: Allows you to change the group of the parameter. The action is not available for project parameters
mprParameters.ad4: Allows you to add or remove the binding of shared parameter to categories. The action is not available for project parameters. If you delete a binding to categories, all parameter data will be removed from the elements of these categories
mprParameters.ad6: Allows you to make a family parameter an instance parameter. The action is not available for system parameters
mprParameters.ad7: Allows you to make a shared parameter an instance parameter. The action is not available for project parameters
mprParameters.ad8: Allows you to make a family parameter a type parameter. The action is not available for system parameters
mprParameters.ad9: Allows you to make a shared parameter a type parameter. The action is not available for project parameters
mprParameters.ad10: Allows you to set the "Values can vary by group instance" behavior for parameters
mprParameters.ad11: Allows you to set the "Values are aligned per group type" behavior for parameters
mprParameters.ad12: Allows you to delete the parameter. Action is not available for system parameters
mprParameters.ad13: Allows you to delete the parameter
mprParameters.ad14: Allows you to replace a shared parameter with a family parameter while preserving the parameter name
mprParameters.spf1: Parameter not found in the specified shared parameters file
mprParameters.spf2: Parameter found in the specified shared parameter file
mprParameters.spf3: A parameter with the same name but a different GUID was found in the specified shared parameters file
mprParameters.spf4: A parameter with the same GUID but a different name was found in the specified shared parameters file
mprParameters.spf5: Unable to search for a parameter in a shared parameter file because no shared parameter file is specified
mprParameters.msg1: The formula has been added to the favorites list
mprParameters.msg2: The current formula is not empty. Are you sure to replace it with a formula from the favorites list?
mprParameters.msg3: Shared parameter is already present in the current parameter list
mprParameters.msg4: A parameter with this name, data type and grouping is already present in the current parameter list
mprParameters.msg5: All selected parameters cannot be renamed
mprParameters.msg7: Are you sure you want to remove the type "{0}"?
mprParameters.msg10: The parameter creation is skipped, because the family already has such a parameter
mprParameters.msg12: The parameter has not been created
mprParameters.msg13: The value of the parameter is set
mprParameters.msg14: Failed to set the parameter value
mprParameters.msg16: Failed to update the parameter formula
mprParameters.msg28: The formula editor will be opened without the ability to validate the formula
mprParameters.msg29: No Shared Parameter File has been set in the current project
mprParameters.msg30: Check if the parameter name and type values are filled in
mprParameters.msg31: Check if the parameter name, type, group and category list values are filled in
mprParameters.msg32: The entered value does not match the parameter type
mprParameters.msg33: The Revit API does not allow to create or edit parameters in families of some types. Loading such families is skipped
mprParameters.msg34: Preset "{0}" will be irrevocably deleted! Continue?
mprParameters.msg36: Shared parameter replaced by Family parameter
mprParameters.msg37: The parameter is bound to categories:
mprParameters.msg38: The parameter is unbound from the categories:
mprParameters.msg39: The plugin is only available in the family document!
mprParameters.err1: An unexpected error occurred during window initialization
mprParameters.err2: An unexpected error occurred when closing the window
mprParameters.err3: An error occurred while creating the parameter
mprParameters.err8: Failed to execute action with parameter "{0}"
mprParameters.err9: Parameter with GUID "{0}" is omitted because no SPF is specified
mprParameters.err10: Parameter with GUID "{0}" is not found in the current SPF
mprParameters.err11: Not recognized data type "{0}" for parameter
mprParameters.err15: The family has been saved in a later version of Revit
mprParameters.err16: Unable to set the value "{0}" to an integer parameter
mprParameters.err18: Instance Parameters can't be used in Type Parameter formulas
mprParameters.err20: Failed to create parameter "{0}" in family "{1}"
mprParameters.err21: The family is not loaded because the family file has a "Read Only" attribute
mprParameters.err22: Failed to set a formula to a parameter because an uncontrolled error occurred in the Revit API, indicating a bug in the Revit API. To set a formula to this parameter, use the standard parameter editing dialog
mprParameters.err23: Specify the name of the preset
mprParameters.err24: There is already a preset with this name in the storage. The existing preset will be overwritten!
mprParameters.err25: The preset name must not contain the following characters: \ / : * ? " < > |
mprParameters.err26: Preset storage directory is missing! Make sure you have access to create folders and files in the UserData directory or contact your system administrator
mprParameters.err28: A parameter named "{0}" has already been defined. Set another name
mprParameters.err29: The selected family is the current family. Select another family
mprParameters.err31: Failed to set the formula. Error:
mprParameters.err32: The parameter value cannot be imported
mprParameters.err33: Failed to undo the changes made because the current document is not a document of the edited family. Switch to the family document and undo the changes manually
mprParameters.err34: A parameter with the data type "Image" cannot be an instance parameter
